metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14433 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in OpenStack Nova before 17.0.12, 18.x before18.2.2, and 19.x before 19.0.2. If an API request from an authenticateduser ends in a fault condition due to an external exception, details of theunderlying environment may be leaked in the response, and could includesensitive configuration or other data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14433` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-api - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-api-metadata - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-api-os-compute - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-api-os-volume - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-cells - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-common - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-compute - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-compute-kvm - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-compute-libvirt - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-compute-lxc - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-compute-qemu - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-compute-vmware - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-compute-xen - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-conductor - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-console - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-consoleauth - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-network - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-novncproxy - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-placement-api - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-scheduler - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-serialproxy - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-spiceproxy - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-volume - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
nova-xvpvncproxy - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
python-nova - 2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nova package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:17.0.10-0ubuntu2.1').
